report_title: Industry Research: Cruise & Travel Agency Franchises
executive_summary: Overall, the Cruise and Travel Agency Franchises industry has experienced significant growth over the five years to 2022. Despite the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, strong performance throughout most of the current period contributed to growth in demand for cruises and travel as a whole. Cruise ships remained largely in port during 2020 due to a "no sail" order and travel was extremely limited. As a result, industry revenue is estimated to grow an annualized 13.8% to $5.1 billion over the past five years. Moreover, pent-up demand for travel, rising per capita disposable income and a return to the water for cruise ships began to assist the industry in 2021 and is expected to continue doing so in 2022 and beyond.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: IBISWorld estimates that revenue for the Cruise and Travel Agency Franchises industry will increase an annualized 13.8% to $5.1 billion over the five years to 2022. The industry experienced an extreme contraction in demand due to the COVID-19 pandemic and decline in international and domestic travel, with cruise ships forced to remain docked throughout most of 2020 under a "no sail" order.
Revenue is anticipated to rise 69.9% in 2022 amid pent-up demand for cruises, growth in consumer spending and a return to travel.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry is anticipated to rebound over the five years to 2027, in line with a continued recovery of the travel sector from lows endured during the coronavirus pandemic. Industry revenue is estimated to grow an annualized 3.9% to $6.2 billion over the next five years.
The popularity of cruises among Americans will likely benefit the industry, as the United States accounts for more than half of the world market for cruises.
Competition from travel websites and nonfranchised travel agencies will continue to threaten the industry over the next five years.

industry_definition: This industry includes franchised travel agent establishments that sell travel, tour and accommodation services and packages. Online sales are excluded from this industry.

negative_impact_factors: Low and steady barriers to entry
Low and steady level of assistance

key_trends: Cruise ships were forced to remain docked throughout most of 2020
Growing popularity of online travel packages has increasingly threatened the industry
The percentage of travel agents that are home-based agencies has increased
The global travel sector is anticipated to rebound strongly after a lackluster 2020
The industry is expected to prosper due to pent-up demand for cruises
Online booking and discount sites will continue to threaten industry players
The coronavirus pandemic halted cruise boats for more than a year

market_segmentation.segment_description: Travelers taking domestic trips within the US for leisure purposes.
Travelers taking international trips outside the US for leisure purposes.
Business travel that is not managed by a corporate travel department.
Business travel that is managed by a corporate travel department.

products_and_services.product_description: Airline bookings for international and domestic flights.
Bookings for tours and packaged travel.
Other services like travel insurance, fees, etc.

tier_2_suppliers: Scheduled and Charter Bus Services in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Movements in real household disposable income are important for leisure travel and are affected by changes in tax and interest rates, the rate of employment growth and other factors, such as gas prices.

The introduction of new airline technology affects the cost of airfare and demand for travel, while other factors include traveler demand moving away from standardized packaged tours and more toward individual arrangements to enable for more independent travel.

Global air travel has increased rapidly over the past few decades due to aircraft with larger capacity, better fuel efficiency and new routes. However, fluctuating commodity prices, such as oil, heavily influence the prices of airline travel.

Technological change is a major factor that affects demand for travel agents, with the internet and internet-based systems of particular importance. Travelers are now more likely than ever to make their own direct bookings and reservations via travel websites.

Business travel, including attendance at seminars and conferences, accounts for a small proportion of industry demand. Changes in economic growth, business confidence and profitability influence this type of travel.

business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic region has the largest percentage of industry establishments, representing 22.5% of industry business locations in 2022. Home to three major US cities, New York City, Philadelphia and Washington, DC, this region has several areas that have high international recognition and are population dense.

The Southeast region of the United States has the second-largest share of business locations, representing 22.1% of establishments in 2022. This region is very popular for industry establishments because it has the largest share of the US population, accounting for 25.8% of the population, and is also home to many port cities, tourist attractions and other commercial centers.

The West region has the third-highest concentration of industry business locations. In 2022, an estimated 21.3% of business locations are located in the West, primarily concentrated in California, which represents 15.3% of establishments. This region and state have many internationally recognized cities, such as Los Angeles and San Diego. This region also has some of the most internationally recognized tourism destinations, including Las Vegas, Hollywood, Disneyland and the Grand Canyon.

regulations_points.regulation_description: A consumer protection fund operated by industry associations handles consumer protection related to the retail component.
The industry contended with increased regulation during the COVID-19 pandemic, with cruise restrictions and travel mandates.
There are federal and state laws governing franchising that vary across states.

barriers_points.barrier_description: There are relatively low start-up costs associated with opening a new location with an existing travel agency franchise.
Potential franchisees compete with existing franchisees that have developed industry knowledge and specializations.
One barrier is availability of substitutes like travel websites and booking systems of travel providers.

factors_decreased_barrier: Regulation Level is light and increasing
Globalization Level is low but increasing

basis_points.basis_description: Competition has become largely price-based, with operators needing to offer best prices for travel.
Non-price factors like service quality, destination knowledge, and location are also important for some agencies.
External competition from direct online booking systems of travel providers is very high and increasing.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The top 4 players account for an estimated 76.4% of industry revenue in 2022.
Major brands like Cruise Planners and CruiseShipCenters have grown their market share.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Franchise fees and royalties vary between operator and business structure, ranging from as low as 5.0% to as high as 9.0% of industry revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: This industry is primarily service-based, meaning that the industry is labor intensive.
Operators in the industry are exposed to relatively few capital costs. Buildings and equipment can easily be rented or leased and little heavy machinery is required.
Many operators in the industry work from home offices which have few major capital requirements.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The onset of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic has introduced extreme volatility to the industry as travel sharply declined in 2020.
Increasing competition with online travel operators has contributed to volatility in recent years.
Volatile commodity prices, such as the price oil, coupled with global economic uncertainty, have further contributed to this volatility.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The widespread use of the internet has been a game changer for the modern travel agency and has both helped and hurt the industry.
Mega-computerized reservation systems enable more effective sales of travel insurance policies and electronic account settling.
High-speed internet and improved online interfaces let travel agents connect with customers faster and more effectively.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche service or bundle its services to attract clients?
FAQs.answer: Franchisees that offer specialty packages often attract niche clientele, which may alienate market share. However, these niche packages run at higher premiums, producing larger profit.

FAQs.question: How do you market your services to potential clients?
FAQs.answer: Internet-based advertising is becoming increasingly important among consumers as that is where they primarily look to research and book travel arrangements.

FAQs.question: Has your company implemented practices to lower purchasing costs?
Does your company target a particular market segment or provide for a broad range of markets?
FAQs.answer: Many franchises tend to focus on consumers with high incomes as they typically book the most expensive and profitable trips. As cruises begin to offer budget trips, franchisees can benefit from selling large numbers of lower-income vacations.

FAQs.question: Does your company use mobile applications to improve client services and consumer experience?
FAQs.answer: Many companies are launching mobile applications to recapture consumers they are losing to external competitors that offer heavy web-based booking and planning options.

FAQs.question: Does your business use web-based systems for customer bookings or orders?
FAQs.answer: Mega-computerized reservation systems (CRS) help franchisees book domestic and international travel plans through online platforms.

FAQs.question: No licenses or certifications are necessary to become a travel agent.
FAQs.answer: This is a statement, not a question.

FAQs.question: How do franchise agreements affect your business?
FAQs.answer: Franchising laws vary from state to state. Federally, the FTC regulates franchise agreements that franchisees and franchisers must abide by.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Many cruise and vacation options, especially internationally, can be offered year-round due to varying seasons across the globe. Many franchises will offer discounts for vacations in off-peak seasons.

FAQs.question: How dependent is your company on borrowed finances?
FAQs.answer: Franchisees often take out loans or borrow money to pay initial franchise fees which can vary greatly depending upon the franchise agreement. The higher the franchise fee, the more dependent a franchise might become on loans or debt.

FAQs.question: Do you have access to the latest available and most efficient technology and techniques? How do you capitalize on technology changes?
FAQs.answer: Having internet-based communications, reservation, business operations and information technology is vital. This trend has been exacerbated by the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

FAQs.question: How do you make sure your prices are attractive to customers? How do your pricing policies compare with your competitors?
FAQs.answer: It is important to ensure that product pricing and packaging is undertaken properly and with adequate profit accrual built in.

FAQs.question: How does your coverage compare with that of your competitors? How diverse is your product and service offerings?
FAQs.answer: Operators can gain a competitive advantage if they have a wide variety of information and travel packages to suit specialized or niche travelers' needs as well as those of general and business travelers.

FAQs.question: How has rising competition affected your business? How much of your business is conducted through the internet?
FAQs.answer: E-commerce sales, including the sale of travel packages, are growing at a rapid rate. Online sales of travel packages are excluded from the industry and are, thus, a form of external competition.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the consumer confidence index? How do you mitigate declines in consumer confidence?
FAQs.answer: The level of consumer and business sentiment affects travel demand regarding travel plans, expenditure and booking in advance. Consumer confidence is estimated to rise in 2022.

FAQs.question: How do you measure trends in consumer spending? How can you capitalize on increasing consumer spending?
FAQs.answer: Changes in consumer spending affect how much people spend on travel-related expenses. As consumer spending increases, domestic and international travel spending is likely to increase as well. Consumer spending is estimated to rise in 2022, benefiting the industry.
